benchmark_details.name: HealthSLM-Bench
benchmark_details.overview: HealthSLM-Bench is a comprehensive benchmark that systematically evaluates nine state-of-the-art Small Language Models (SLMs) on eight health prediction tasks across three real-world mobile and wearable datasets, employing zero-shot, few-shot, and instruction fine-tuning approaches.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To systematically evaluate Small Language Models for healthcare monitoring tasks across various datasets and deployment scenarios.
purpose_and_intended_users.limitations: Challenges remain, particularly in handling class imbalance and few-shot scenarios.

data.source: PMData, GLOBEM, AW-FB datasets, which provide health wearable sensor data.
data.size: Three datasets with various examples and features for different health tasks.
data.annotation: Self-reported data and physiological data annotations for health statuses.

methodology.calculation: Mean Absolute Error (MAE) is calculated by the average magnitude of prediction errors. Accuracy is the proportion of correctly predicted instances.
methodology.interpretation: Lower MAE values indicate better performance, while accuracy reflects general correctness.
methodology.baseline_results: SLMs generally perform comparably or better than LLMs across health tasks.
methodology.validation: Top-performing models were deployed on an iPhone 15 Pro Max for real-world efficiency evaluation.

targeted_risks.demographic_analysis: Analysis of demographic factors is performed based on the datasets used.

ethical_and_legal_considerations.privacy_and_anonymity: The study enhances protection of sensitive personal data through on-device inference.
